com.rjrudin.marklogic.appdeployer.command.modules

Class LoadModulesCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rjrudin.marklogic.client.LoggingObject
      • com.rjrudin.marklogic.appdeployer.command.AbstractCommand
        • com.rjrudin.marklogic.appdeployer.command.modules.LoadModulesCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Command

    public class LoadModulesCommand
extends AbstractCommand
    Command for loading modules via an instance of DefaultModulesLoader, which depends on an instance of XccAssetLoader - these are all in the ml-javaclient-util library.

      Public so that a client can initialize the ModulesLoader and then access it via the getter; this is useful for a tool like ml-gradle, where the ModulesLoader can be reused by multiple tasks.
      protected void loadModulesIntoMainServer(CommandContext context)
      If we have multiple module paths, we want to load via XCC the assets for each first, and then iterate over the paths again and load all the REST API resources.
      protected void loadModulesIntoTestServer(CommandContext context)
      We use a customized impl of DefaultModulesLoader here so we can ensure that options are always loaded again into the test server.

        public void initializeDefaultModulesLoader(CommandContext context)
        Public so that a client can initialize the ModulesLoader and then access it via the getter; this is useful for a tool like ml-gradle, where the ModulesLoader can be reused by multiple tasks.

        public void execute(CommandContext context)
        Description copied from interface: Command

      • loadModulesIntoMainServer

        protected void loadModulesIntoMainServer(CommandContext context)
        If we have multiple module paths, we want to load via XCC the assets for each first, and then iterate over the paths again and load all the REST API resources. This ensures that if the REST server for loading REST API resources has a custom rewriter, it's guaranteed to be loaded before we try to load any REST API resources.
        Parameters:
        context -

      • loadModulesIntoTestServer

        protected void loadModulesIntoTestServer(CommandContext context)
        We use a customized impl of DefaultModulesLoader here so we can ensure that options are always loaded again into the test server.
        Parameters:
        context -
